arabic: وَالطُّورِ
english: By (the Mountain) Tur,

arabic: وَكِتَابٍ مَّسْطُورٍ
english: And by the Book inscribed,

arabic: فِي رَقٍّ مَّنشُورٍ
english: (Which is) on an Unfolded Scroll,

arabic: وَالْبَيْتِ الْمَعْمُورِ
english: And by the House populated (by the angels i.e., the Ka‘ba in heaven),

arabic: وَالسَّقْفِ الْمَرْفُوعِ
english: And by the Lofty Roof (i.e., the High Heaven or the Most Exalted Throne),

arabic: وَالْبَحْرِ الْمَسْجُورِ
english: And by the swelling sea!

arabic: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَاقِعٌ
english: Surely, the torment of your Lord will do take place.

arabic: مَّا لَهُ مِن دَافِعٍ
english: No one can avert it.

arabic: يَوْمَ تَمُورُ السَّمَاءُ مَوْرًا
english: The Day when the heaven will shake with a terrible tremor,

arabic: وَتَسِيرُ الْجِبَالُ سَيْرًا
english: And the mountains (leaving their locations) will fly fast (like clouds) and scatter (like dust particles),

arabic: فَوَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: So on that Day, woe to those who belie,

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي خَوْضٍ يَلْعَبُونَ
english: Those who are playing a game of negligence, rapt in falsehood (i.e., absurdity).

arabic: يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا
english: The Day when they will be forcefully pushed towards the Fire of Hell,

arabic: هَـٰذِهِ النَّارُ الَّتِي كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
english: (It will be said to them:) ‘This is the Fire of Hell you used to belie.

arabic: أَفَسِحْرٌ هَـٰذَا أَمْ أَنتُمْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
english: So is it magic, or do you not see?

arabic: اصْلَوْهَا فَاصْبِرُوا أَوْ لَا تَصْبِرُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
english: Enter it. Then it is all the same for you whether you observe patience, or you do not observe patience. You will be paid only for those deeds which you used to do.’

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَعِيمٍ
english: Surely, the Godfearing will be in the Gardens and Bliss.

arabic: فَاكِهِينَ بِمَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ
english: They will be delighted at (the bestowals) their Lord will have blessed them with. And their Lord will keep them safe from the punishment of Hell.

arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
english: (It will be said to them:) ‘Relish food and drink as a reward for the (pious) deeds which you used to do.’

arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَّصْفُوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٍ
english: They will be reclining (sitting) on couches arranged in rows, and We will marry them to maidens with fair colour (and) fascinating eyes.

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَاتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَانٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَا أَلَتْنَاهُم مِّنْ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَيْءٍ ۚ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ
english: And those who believe and whose children follow them in faith, We shall also unite their children with them (in the ranks of Paradise even if their actions would not fall in that grade. It would be in the honour of their pious fathers). And We shall also not reduce in anyway the reward of the actions of their (pious fathers. Besides this,) everyone will be held in (reward and punishment for) his own works.

arabic: وَأَمْدَدْنَاهُم بِفَاكِهَةٍ وَلَحْمٍ مِّمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
english: And We will keep giving them fruit and meat more and more as they desire.

arabic: يَتَنَازَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَّا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ
english: There, they will take the cups (of holy drink) by grabbing. This (holy drink of Paradise) will be free of foolish talk and sinful acts.

arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَّهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَّكْنُونٌ
english: And (the serving) youths will go round them as if they were pearls kept hidden in covers.

arabic: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
english: And they will turn to one another, enquiring well-being.

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِي أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ
english: They will say: ‘Surely before this, we used to live in fear (of Allah’s torment) in our homes.

arabic: فَمَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَانَا عَذَابَ السَّمُومِ
english: So Allah has been Gracious to favour us and has saved us from the punishment of the Fire of Hell.

arabic: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْبَرُّ الرَّحِيمُ
english: Indeed, we used to worship Him alone beforehand. Surely, He is Most Gracious, Ever-Merciful.’

arabic: فَذَكِّرْ فَمَا أَنتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ
english: So, (O Esteemed Beloved,) continue to admonish (them). By the grace and blessing of your Lord, you are neither a soothsayer (the one who gives news through the jinn) nor a madman.

arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِ رَيْبَ الْمَنُونِ
english: Do the disbelievers say: ‘(He is) a poet for whom we look forward to some temporal disasters’?

arabic: قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا فَإِنِّي مَعَكُم مِّنَ الْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ
english: Say: ‘Wait on, I am also waiting together with you (for your destruction).’

arabic: أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَامُهُم بِهَـٰذَا ۚ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
english: Do their mental faculties suggest them this (foolishness), or are they rioters and rebels?

arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُ ۚ بَل لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
english: Or do they say: ‘He (the Messenger) has invented it (the Qur’an) himself’? (No indeed;) rather they simply do not believe (in the truth).

arabic: فَلْيَأْتُوا بِحَدِيثٍ مِّثْلِهِ إِن كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ
english: So let them produce a treatise like this (Qur’an) if they are truthful.

arabic: أَمْ خُلِقُوا مِنْ غَيْرِ شَيْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ الْخَالِقُونَ
english: Have they been created by nothing, or are they themselves the creators?

arabic: أَمْ خَلَقُوا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۚ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ
english: Or did they create the heavens and the earth themselves? (No,) in fact, they do not have any faith (in the truth).

arabic: أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ الْمُصَيْطِرُونَ
english: Or do they own the treasures of your Lord? Or are they guards and watchmen over them?

arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُم بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
english: Or do they have any ladder (by which they ascend) and listen stealthily (to the heaven)? So let the listener amongst them bring the clear proof.

arabic: أَمْ لَهُ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَكُمُ الْبَنُونَ
english: Are there daughters for Him (the Lord) and sons for you?

arabic: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
english: Do you ask them for wages that they are weighed down with debt?

arabic: أَمْ عِندَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
english: Do they have (the knowledge of) the unseen that they write down?

arabic: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا ۖ فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا هُمُ الْمَكِيدُونَ
english: Do they seek to deceive (you) by trickery? Those who disbelieve are being caught in their own trap.

arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَـٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
english: Do they have any god other than Allah? Glory be to Allah, above all what they set up as a partner (with Allah).

arabic: وَإِن يَرَوْا كِسْفًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا سَحَابٌ مَّرْكُومٌ
english: And if they see a fragment of the sky falling (on them, even then) they will say: ‘It is a layered (thick) cloud.’

arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ
english: So leave them (in their plight) till they meet that Day of theirs when they will be destroyed,

arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
english: The Day when their plots will be of no use to them, nor will they be helped.

arabic: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
english: And for those who are committed to doing wrong, there is a torment for them besides this torment as well but most of them do not know.

arabic: وَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا ۖ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
english: And, (O Esteemed Beloved, do not grieve over what they say). Wait patiently for the command of your Lord. Surely, you are (at all times) before Our Eyes.* And glorify your Lord with His praise whenever you stand forth.

arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَإِدْبَارَ النُّجُومِ
english: And also glorify Him during the hours of the night and (in later part of it) when the stars fade out.
